page.title: 14Boxing Day Walk in Ropley
page.content: The Boxing Day Walk was first started 11 years ago by Mr J.C.Macinnes as a way of walking off the effect of the Christmas lunch and raising money.The walk,which is along local footpaths, starts and finishes at one of the 3 local inns which take it in turn to host the walk.People of all ages are welcome to take part either raising money through sponsorship or just to enjoy the walking.Walkers can start any time from 10-11.30 and we cover about 5 miles. We walk whatever the weather - fine,rain or snow!Over 200 people have taken part and many dogs join their owners on the walk.Last year the money raised went to help the Parish Hall and one year it was to help buy more handbells.The 1985 walk will start from the Anchor and the proceeds will go to the Village Pond Fund and to the Ropley Girl Guides.
